meanings.definition: A person or group of people holding a sign or banner outside a building to protest or demonstrate.
meanings.sent1: The picketers gathered outside the factory, holding signs and chanting for fair wages.
meanings.sent2: The picketers peacefully protested outside City Hall, demanding action on climate change.
meanings.sent3: The picketers outside the ice cream shop were not protesting, but rather promoting a new flavor.
meanings.sent4: The picketers outside the courthouse stood like a wall of determination, their signs like shields.
meanings.sent5: The image of the picketers outside the school will forever be etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: To stand or march outside a building with signs to protest or demonstrate.
meanings.sent1: We will picketers outside the mayor's office tomorrow to demand better healthcare.
meanings.sent2: They picketers in front of the company headquarters, calling for better working conditions.
meanings.sent3: The group decided to picketers outside the movie theater to raise awareness about animal rights.
meanings.sent4: She picketers outside the bank, her voice echoing through the streets.
meanings.sent5: The activists picketers outside the government building, their determination unwavering.
